name: Infusionsoft CRM by Keap
description: Add an Infusionsoft Instance to connect your existing Infusionsoft account to the CRM Hub, allowing you to manage contacts, leads, accounts, opportunities etc. across multiple CRM Elements. You will need your Infusionsoft account information to add an instance.

configuration.name: Infusionsoft Server
configuration.description: The server where your Infusionsoft CRM account resides

configuration.name: Allow Select Fields parameter
configuration.description: Enables use of global fields query parameter to filter response to only specified fields. This will override any existing vendor functionality on the connector

configuration.name: Max Page Size (or limit)
configuration.description: Infusionsoft Beta Max Page Size (or limit)

configuration.name: Infusionsoft Encrypted Key
configuration.description: The Infusionsoft CRM encrypted key, which can be found by logging in to your Infusionsoft account online. This is the API key of the app under use.

configuration.name: Filter null values from the response
configuration.description: Used to enable/disable filtering of null values from the responses.

configuration.name: Default select fields
configuration.description: Generic map used to specify default fields for bulk download and GET /all requests. Each key should be the canonical objectName and values may be specified as a comma-delimited string or a list of strings

configuration.name: Event Notification Callback URL
configuration.description: Infusionsoft Beta Event Notification Callback URL

configuration.name: Callback Notification Signature Key
configuration.description: A key used to generate a validation hash header of the event/bulk notification webhook callback payload

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for all contacts whose email address equals 'user@cloud-elements.com', the search expression parameter will be where=Email = 'user@cloud-elements.com'. Currently, search by email address is the only supported search.

contactsListObject.description: Retrieves a list of all contacts

contactsPostReq.description: Creates a new contact record from the data passed
